findings.title: Arbitrary Setting of User Referral
findings.description: The `buy()` function allows anyone to set the referral address of any user arbitrarily.

findings.title: Safe-Version Replacement With safeApprove()
findings.description: The `approve()` function does not have a return value which may cause unexpected reverts when interacting with certain token contracts.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the Poop token contract and related protocols, there is a special administrative account, i.e., `owner`. This `owner` account plays a critical role in governing and regulating the protocol-wide operations.

findings.title: Time and State
findings.description: Weaknesses related to improper management of time and state in an environment supporting simultaneous or near-simultaneous computation by multiple systems, processes, or threads.

findings.title: Error Conditions, Return Values, Status Codes
findings.description: Weaknesses in this category include weaknesses that occur if a function does not generate the correct return/status code, or if the application does not handle all possible return/status codes that could be generated by a function.

findings.title: Resource Management
findings.description: Weaknesses in this category are related to improper management of system resources.

findings.title: Behavioral Issues
findings.description: Weaknesses in this category are related to unexpected behaviors from code that an application uses.

findings.title: Business Logics Review
findings.description: Review business logics, examine system operations, and place DeFi-related aspects under scrutiny to uncover possible pitfalls and/or bugs.

findings.title: Arguments and Parameters
findings.description: Weaknesses in this category are related to improper use of arguments or parameters within function calls.

findings.title: Expression Issues
findings.description: Weaknesses in this category are related to incorrectly written expressions within code.
